stem: Primary motions at the knee occur in which plane with accessory axial rotation during flexion/extension?

choices.C: Sagittal plane; flexion/extension with accessory rotation
choices.E: No true plane; pure rolling only

rationale_correct: Knee is primarily a sagittal-plane joint (flexion/extension) with gliding/rolling and accessory axial rotation.

rationale_distractors.A: Varus/valgus are constraints rather than primary motions.
rationale_distractors.B: Axial rotation occurs as an accessory motion, not the sole primary motion.
rationale_distractors.D: Abduction/adduction are limited at the knee.
rationale_distractors.E: Knee is not pure rolling; it includes gliding and rotation.
